text: Had a great time at this restaurant during my visit to Singapore.  Food was fresh, high quality and reasonablely priced.  Proactive and attentive service and warm ambience.  Highly recommend, when looking for a taste of Japan while in Singapore.  We did.
Decent unagi fried rice, uni rice not bad also. But you get a bit tired of it halfway. Crackers wer weren't bad but way overpriced even for a side dish for alcohol. Very cute cat chopsticks stand.

Finding the right spot to celebrate a birthday can be a bit of a challenge. Hanashizuku at Cuppage Plaza turned out to be just the place—cozy, intimate, and all about good food without the fuss.

We kicked things off with salmon sashimi, thick-cut and silky, each bite melting in the mouth with just the right balance of sweetness and umami. Then came the asari clams, swimming in a delicate mushroom sake broth, their briny juices perfect for sipping straight from the shell. But the real showstopper was the grilled Iberico pork—charred beautifully on the outside, juicy and full of rich, nutty depth within. It was one of those dishes that made everyone at the table pause for a moment, nodding in quiet appreciation.

Of course, no celebration is complete without a good bottle, so we poured ourselves some Dassai 45 — a crisp, smooth DaiGinjo and just fruity enough—the perfect match for our meal, elevating every bite without overpowering. By the end of the night, we were stuffed, savouring the warmth of good food and family bonding.

This restaurant serves one of the most delightful Japanese cuisines. Deep Fried Chicken Cartilage, Spicy Tuna Roll and Stir Fried Sliced Beef Tongue are some of the go-to dishes.

We also had lasting impression with the staff, especially Chounan. She was attentive and hospitable, making this a highly-recommended place to visit to satisfy any cravings for authentic Japanese food.

Find a hidden gems restaurant located in Cuppage Plaza!
The food here is really suprise me, very Authentic and the atmosphere is feels like in japan! The saff here was very friendly also, very worth the price, will try their other dishes next visit.
